title: Blinken warns Russia may be 'attempting to rehash' 2014 invasion of Ukraine
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday that the US is concerned by reports of unusual Russian military activity and the possibility that Russia may be "attempting to rehash" its 2014 invasion of Ukraine.

title: Enes Kanter felt encouraged to speak out against China after NBA supported players fighting other injustices
description: Boston Celtics star Enes Kanter says he felt encouraged to speak out against China after the NBA supported players in fighting other injustices and human rights issues.

title: How grocery stores are handling rising food prices
description: Giant Company CEO Nicholas Bertram explains how the supermarket will brace for inflated food prices this holiday season

title: China surprises COP26 summit with pledge to work with US, but doesn't budge on climate goals
Measles is a renewed global threat after 22 million babies missed vaccinations, CDC warns
description: The global threat of measles has become worse after 22 million babies missed their vaccinations because of the Covid-19 pandemic, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned Wednesday.

title: The US and China agree to ramp up their climate ambitions, just days before the end of COP26 summit in Glasgow -- but Beijing doesn't budge on goals
description: The US and China announced an agreement Wednesday to ramp up their climate ambitions, just days before the end of the COP26 summit in Glasgow.

title: Ukraine detains alleged head of illegal prison accused of torture and execution of inmates
description: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has detained the alleged head of an illegal prison who is accused of involvement in the murder and torture of Ukrainian citizens, the agency said in a statement.

title: Top EU official: Belarus is 'weaponizing human suffering' to attack Europe
description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks with European Union Commission (EU) Vice President Margaritis Schinas, who accused Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko of "weaponizing human suffering" to attack the EU by facilitating a standoff between migrants and Polish authorities at the Polish-Belarusian border.

title: 'Don't get brazen with me': Judge has heated exchange with prosecutor
description: Judge Bruce Schroeder and prosecutor Thomas Binger get into an exchange during the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse.

title: Top automakers' blow to COP26
description: The biggest players in the automotive industry are refusing to back a commitment to sell only zero-emissions cars and vans by 2040, dealing a blow to hopes for major progress on the climate crisis at COP26.

title: Ethiopia's leader said he would bury his enemy. His spokeswoman doesn't think it was incitement to violence
Pregnant Yemeni journalist killed in car explosion
description: A pregnant Yemeni journalist was killed in a car explosion in the coastal city of Aden Tuesday, Prime Minister Maeen Abdulmalek  of the Saudi-backed internationally recognized government said, according to Yemen News Agency.

title: PSG player in police custody in connection with alleged attack on teammate
description: Paris Saint-Germain and France midfielder Aminata Diallo has been taken into police custody in connection with an attack on a teammate, the French club said on Wednesday.

title: See CNN anchor learn traditional Irish dance from iconic group
description: Riverdance, the iconic Irish dancing group that burst onto the scene in 1994, will soon take to the stage at the Expo 2020 Dubai. CNN's Becky Anderson speaks to Riverdance crew and even joins in a quick jig.

title: Actor Matthew McConaughey against vaccine mandates for kids
description: Actor Matthew McConaughey tells the New York Times he is currently against mandating vaccines for children. US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy and Erin Burnett discuss.

title: Analysis: How Trump emboldened autocrats around the world
description: CNN's John Avlon looks at increasing authoritarianism around the world and the importance of fighting for democracy.

title: Audio recordings reveal NRA called members 'hillbillies' and 'fruitcakes'
description: In audio recordings obtained by NPR, National Rifle Association officials appear to call some members "hillbillies" and "fruitcakes" during a 1999 meeting to discuss the possibility of canceling the NRA's annual meeting following the then-recent Columbine shooting.

title: US and Europe experience dramatic reversal in Covid fortunes
description: • Brothel offers free entry, but there's a catch

title: American journalist hit with terrorism and sedition charges in Myanmar
description: American journalist Danny Fenster has been hit with two new criminal charges in Myanmar that carry a maximum sentence of 20 years in prison, his lawyer said.

title: CNN Poll: Three out of four adults think Facebook is making society worse
description: Roughly three-quarters of adults believe Facebook is making American society worse, a new CNN poll conducted by SSRS finds, with about half saying they know somebody who was persuaded to believe in a conspiracy theory because of the site's content.

title: While countries argue over who should pay for the climate crisis, half of this coastal community has been washed away by the sea
description: Standing on the sand next to a building hollowed out by the churning sea, Sheriff Elegushi points far out into the Atlantic Ocean to where his ancestral home once stood.

title: The travelers who are turning their backs on airplanes
description: A few years ago, Charlotte Wolf returned from a trip around the world and totted up the number of flights she'd taken.

title: Evergrande's billionaire founder has been bailing out the business. That can't continue
description: Evergrande is staring down about $8 billion worth of debt obligations due to foreign investors over the next year. The company's billionaire founder and chairman may have to pay at least some of that out of his own pocket.

title: Prince Harry says he warned Twitter CEO about potential 'coup' before Capitol riot
description: Prince Harry talked about his personal experiences with misinformation during WIRED's RE:WIRED virtual conference.

title: How one image changed the dialogue around the climate crisis
description: I've spent most of my career as a storyteller, using stunning visual imagery and compelling personal stories to move people. Moving people is exactly what's needed to save our planet. We cannot afford to stand still any longer, let alone go backwards.
